Notes: The preliminary investigation indicates that a maroon, 1997 Honda CRV was traveling southbound in the 2100 block of Burton Drive when the driver lost control, drove off the left side of the roadway and struck a concrete retaining wall. The driver of the vehicle, Shane Carson Goldstein, was pronounced deceased on the scene. This case is still being investigated. Anyone with information regarding this incident is asked to call the APD Vehicular Homicide Unit Detectives at (512) 974-4424. You can also submit tips by downloading APD’s mobile app, Austin PD, for free on iPhone and Android. This is Austin’s 71st fatal traffic crash and the 76th fatality of 2017. At this time in 2016, there were 75 fatal traffic crashes and 77 traffic fatalities. These statements are based on the initial assessment of the fatal crash and investigation is still pending. Fatality information may change.

The preliminary investigation indicates that a 2002, blue, Chevrolet truck was traveling southbound in the 8400 block of Research Blvd. in the inside lane when it swerved into the right lane to avoid a collision. When the Chevrolet entered the right lane, it struck a 1998 BMW motorcycle from behind, knocking the driver off the bike and over a retaining wall. The driver fell to the frontage road where he sustained serious injuries. The driver of the motorcycle was transported to Dell Seton Medical Center at the University of Texas where he died as a result of his injuries on Wednesday, December 13, 2017.

The preliminary investigation indicates that a 2017 Harley Davidson motorcycle was traveling westbound on Cesar Chavez when the driver lost control, left the roadway and struck several objects. The driver was pronounced deceased at the scene.

The preliminary investigation indicates that a 2010, blue Hyundai was traveling southbound on Northeast Dr. The driver of the vehicle lost control, left the roadway and struck a telephone pole. The passenger, Dominique Gaines, was pronounced deceased at the scene. The driver of the vehicle was transported to Dell Seton Medical Center at the University of Texas with life-threatening injuries.

The preliminary investigation indicates that the 2007 Suzuki GSX-R Motorcycle operated by Proenza-Benedit was in the left lane of the Research Blvd. service road traveling at a high rate of speed when the driver of a 2004 GMC 2500 truck turned from Jamestown Drive on to the service road. The motorcycle struck the right rear tire of the truck and lost control. The motorcyclist was pronounced deceased at the scene.

The preliminary investigation shows that a silver, 2017 Kia Sorento was traveling southbound in the far left lane of the 13100 block of N. I-35. The pedestrian was running across I-35 towards the northbound lanes, when he was struck by the Sorento.

The preliminary investigation shows that the driver of a silver, 1979 Vespa Moped was traveling southbound on N. Lamar Blvd. The Moped crossed into oncoming traffic and was hit by a 2017 Toyota Corolla that was traveling northbound on N. Lamar Blvd. The driver of the Moped died at the scene.

The preliminary investigation shows that the driver of a silver, 2008 Toyota Highlander had just existed the SH-45 ramp and was attempting to merge onto S. IH-35 southbound when the motorist struck Juan Estrada, who was standing in the road. The pedestrian was pronounced deceased at the site of the crash. The driver remained on scene. This case is still being investigated. Anyone with information regarding this incident is asked to call the APD Vehicular Homicide Unit Detectives at (512) 974-8544. You can also submit tips by downloading APD’s mobile app, Austin PD, for free on iPhone and Android. This is Austin’s 64th fatal traffic crash and the 69th fatality of 2017. At this time in 2016, there were 69 fatal traffic crashes and 71 traffic fatalities. These statements are based on the initial assessment of the fatal crash and investigation is still pending. Fatality information may change.

The preliminary investigation shows that the driver of a black, 2017 Ford Fusion was traveling eastbound in the center lane in the 800 block of W. Slaughter Lane when the motorist struck Sean Gayle, who was crossing midblock. The pedestrian was pronounced deceased at the crash site. The motorist remained on scene. This case is still being investigated. Anyone with information regarding this incident is asked to call the APD Vehicular Homicide Unit Detectives at (512) 974-8544. You can also submit tips by downloading APD’s mobile app, Austin PD, for free on iPhone and Android. This is Austin’s 63rd fatal traffic crash and the 68th fatality of 2017. The preliminary investigation shows that a silver, 2001 Lexus was traveling westbound in the 4200 block of E. MLK Jr. Blvd. at a high rate of speed when, for unknown reasons, the vehicle left the roadway at the north curb line and drove partially on the grassy shoulder. The vehicle then went back onto the roadway and crossed both westbound lanes of E. MLK Jr. Blvd. and into the path of an eastbound, grey, Nissan Cube. The driver of the Lexus was ejected from the vehicle. Both drivers were transported to the hospital and the driver of the Lexus died as a result of her injuries. This case is still being investigated. Anyone with information regarding this incident is asked to call the APD Vehicular Homicide Unit Detectives at (512) 974-8544. You can also submit tips by downloading APD’s mobile app, Austin PD, for free on iPhone and Android. This is Austin’s 62nd fatal traffic crash and the 67th fatality of 2017. The preliminary investigation shows that a silver, 2010 Jaguar was driving southbound on IH 35 in the 5300 block when a pedestrian ran across the southbound lanes of IH 35. The Jaguar hit the pedestrian. The pedestrian died at the scene. The driver of the Jaguar remained on scene and cooperated. No charges are expected to be filed against the driver.
Brianna Moreno, Hispanic female (D.O.B. 9-7-98)

Location: Spicewood Springs Rd. and Scotland Well Dr.
Notes: The preliminary investigation shows that a red, 2007 Mazda 6 was driving southbound on Spicewood Springs Rd. at a high rate of speed. The vehicle lost control and struck a traffic light pole, which is located on the southwest corner of Spicewood Springs Rd. and Scotland Well Dr.

The preliminary investigation shows that a blue, 2002 Yamaha motorcycle was driving northbound in the 1300 block of Thornberry Rd. at a high rate of speed. The driver of the motorcycle failed to navigate a sharp curve to head east on to Crozier Ln. and struck a metal gate along the north side of Crozier Ln.

The preliminary investigation shows that a blue, Ford pickup truck was driving southbound on Chicon Street when it struck a pedestrian who was walking in a southeast direction in the intersection of Chicon and Willow streets. After striking the pedestrian, the Ford truck briefly stopped but then fled the scene southbound on Chicon St. without stopping and rendering aid to the pedestrian. The pedestrian, identified as Mauricio Marcos Morales, was transported to Dell Seton Medical Center at the University of Texas where he died a short time later.

Location: Intersection of E. 7th and Comal Street
Notes: The preliminary investigation shows that a silver, 2010 Toyota Corolla was traveling southbound on Comal Street when the driver, who had a green light, entered the intersection to turn left on to 7th Street when the green, 2011 Triumph Motorcycle driven by Stewart ran the red light hitting the left front side of the Toyota. Stewart was transported by EMS to Dell Seton Hospital where he was pronounced deceased shortly after arriving.
The pedestrian was pronounced deceased at the scene.

The preliminary investigation shows that a black, 2013 Nissan Pathfinder, traveling eastbound, in the inside lane of the 5000 block of E. Stassney Lane, struck and killed Castro who was lying in the roadway along the north curb line. The driver remained at the scene.

The preliminary investigation shows that a dark-colored 1999 Ford Van and a white 2016 VW Station Wagon were travelling northbound in the 100 block of the east frontage road when they entered the intersection against a yellow light to turn left on to westbound E. Cesar Chavez at which time the van struck the station wagon. The van lost control and breached the raised curb on the northwest corner fatally striking the victim who was sleeping under the I-35 overpass. The driver remained at the scene.

Location: 100 block of Robert T. Martinez Jr. St.
Notes: The preliminary investigation shows that a white, 2013 Chevrolet Malibu was traveling northbound in the 100 block of Robert T. Martinez Jr. Street, when a pedestrian walked into its path. The pedestrian was crossing from east to west without looking to see if vehicles were approaching.

Location: East Riverside Dr. and Willow Creek Dr.
Notes: The preliminary investigation shows that a white 2013 Honda CRV was traveling westbound on East Riverside Dr. A tan 2003 Nissan Altima was traveling eastbound on East Riverside Drive and attempting to turn northbound into a private driveway at the Willow Creek intersection. The Altima failed to yield right of way turning left. The Honda CRV struck the Altima’s right side with its front. The passenger of the vehicle was transported to Dell Seton Medical Center where she died as a result of her injures on Thursday, September 21, 2017.

The preliminary investigation shows that a white 2012 Dodge Ram was traveling westbound in the 6600 block of McNeil Drive in the outside lane. A pedestrian, identified as Sterlin Adreon Milam, was standing in the roadway when he was struck by the Dodge Ram’s left front. Sterlin Adreon Milam was pronounced deceased at the scene. The preliminary investigation shows that a silver 2006 Jeep Liberty was traveling southbound on U.S. Highway 183 when it struck a blue 2006 Chevrolet Silverado, left the roadway and crashed through residential fences.

Notes: The preliminary investigation shows that a 2009 black Chevrolet Silverado was traveling eastbound in the left lane of William Cannon Drive at a very high rate of speed when it hit the driver’s side of a 2010 black Nissan Altima. The preliminary investigation shows that a 2006 red Kia was traveling northbound in the left lane of N IH-35 in the 8300 block at a high rate of speed when they encountered a pedestrian attempting to run across the highway from east to west. The pedestrian was almost struck by a vehicle in the middle lane before running in front of the Kia. The Kia immediately stopped after hitting the pedestrian. The pedestrian, Kenyae Monique Dixon, was pronounced deceased on the scene at 9:37 p.m.

The preliminary investigation shows that a 2015 red Ducati motorcycle was traveling southbound on Pearl Retreat Lane at a high rate of speed when it pulled alongside of another vehicle travelling southbound and revved the motor. The Ducati motorcycle was traveling southbound in the northbound lane when it accelerated quickly causing the front wheel to lift off ground. The motorcycle lost control while it was on the one wheel. The motorcycle jumped the east curb. The motorcycle continued to travel onto the grass before crossing the street and hitting the fence on the west side of the roadway.
